explanations.machine learning: The paper proposes a novel generative adversarial network (GAN) for corporate credit rating prediction, which is a machine learning approach.
explanations.deep learning: The proposed model, Self-Attention Recurrent Conditional GAN (SAR-CGAN), is a deep learning model that combines GANs with LSTM and self-attention mechanisms.
explanations.neural network: The model uses neural networks, specifically LSTM and GAN architectures, for credit rating prediction.
explanations.long short-term memory: The model adopts LSTM networks to process historical data, which is explicitly mentioned in the abstract.
explanations.LSTM: This is the acronym for long short-term memory, which is a key component of the proposed model.
explanations.attention mechanism: The model includes a self-multi-head attention layer to capture the weighted importance of time series data.
explanations.classification: The task of corporate credit rating prediction can be framed as a classification problem, where ratings are discrete categories.
explanations.feature representation: The model uses financial statement features and CDS spread-related features as input, which involves feature representation.
explanations.representation learning: The model learns representations of the input data through the neural network and attention mechanisms.
